cost_objections.objection: Your pricing is higher than other agencies we've talked to
cost_objections.authentic_response: You're right - we're not the cheapest option. Here's why: [Other agency] likely uses junior staff or offshore teams on your account. We assign senior strategists because [industry/business type] marketing requires [specific expertise]. The real question isn't cost - it's whether you get results. Would you rather spend $[lower amount] and get nothing, or $[our price] and actually hit your growth targets? What matters more - the monthly invoice or the leads it generates?
cost_objections.reframe: Shift conversation from cost to value and risk of cheap solutions

trust_objections.objection: We've been burned by agencies before. How do I know you'll be different?
trust_objections.authentic_response: I'm glad you asked that because it means you're protecting your business. You should be skeptical. Here's what probably happened: [describe common agency failures]. Here's what we do differently: [specific processes, accountability measures, communication cadence]. But don't take my word for it - talk to [reference client in similar situation]. Ask them specifically about [the thing that went wrong before]. Also, we include [specific protection - like performance milestones, monthly reviews, transparent reporting] so you have control and visibility. What specifically went wrong before so I can address whether we've solved for that?
trust_objections.reframe: Acknowledge past pain, demonstrate understanding, provide specific evidence of difference

timing_objections.objection: We're not ready yet / We want to wait until [X]
timing_objections.wrong_approach: Pushing hard or creating false urgency
timing_objections.authentic_response: I appreciate you being thoughtful about timing. Help me understand - what needs to happen before you're ready? [Listen] Here's what I want you to consider: marketing takes 3-6 months to gain real traction. If you wait until [X], you'll then wait another 3-6 months for results. That puts you at [calculate timeline]. Can your business afford to wait [total time] for the lead flow you need? What if we structured this so you're ready to launch at [their timing] but we use the time before to [strategy, planning, foundation work]? That way you're not waiting twice.
timing_objections.reframe: Reveal the hidden cost of delay without pressure

diy_objections.objection: We're going to try handling this ourselves first
diy_objections.wrong_approach: Insulting their capability or being dismissive
diy_objections.authentic_response: That's totally fair - you know your business better than anyone. I'm curious though - what's your plan for [specific complex channel like SEO/paid ads/content strategy]? [Listen] Here's my concern: you'll spend 6-12 months learning through expensive trial and error. Your time is worth $[X]/hour. Marketing will take [Y] hours monthly. That's $[cost] in opportunity cost, plus $[Z] in ad spend or tools, plus the revenue you didn't generate during that learning period. We've already made those mistakes and learned those lessons. Would it make sense to at least have us audit what you're doing in 3 months so you're not heading down a costly path? Or what if we handled [the complex parts] while you kept [the parts they can do well]?
diy_objections.reframe: Respect their choice while illuminating true cost of DIY

roi_objections.wrong_approach: Making promises you can't keep or being defensive
roi_objections.authentic_response: I can't guarantee specific results - anyone who does is lying to you. Here's what I can tell you: we've worked with [X] companies in [industry/similar situation] and [specific result pattern]. But your results depend on factors we control - strategy, execution, optimization - AND factors we don't - your sales team, product-market fit, pricing, close rate. What I can guarantee is [specific deliverables, process rigor, communication, accountability]. The question is: if we deliver [specific activities/outputs], and your business fundamentals are sound, what would success look like? Let's define that together and build in checkpoints so you can see progress and we can course-correct if needed.
roi_objections.reframe: Honest about uncertainty while demonstrating competence and accountability

scope_objections.objection: We only need [one service], not everything you're proposing
scope_objections.wrong_approach: Forcing a package they don't want
scope_objections.authentic_response: Let me ask you this - why do you think you need [service they want]? [Listen] Here's what I'm seeing: [explain why isolated service won't work / what's really needed]. Think of it like going to a doctor saying 'I just need antibiotics' without diagnosis. Maybe you do need just [their service], but maybe the real issue is [actual problem]. We could do just [limited service] - it'll cost $[amount] and you'll get [limited results]. Or we could solve the actual problem with [proper solution] for $[amount] and get [real results]. Which makes more business sense? What's the outcome you're actually trying to achieve?
scope_objections.reframe: Educate on why their prescription may not solve their actual problem

internal_objections.objection: I need to talk to my partner/team/board first
internal_objections.wrong_approach: Trying to prevent the conversation or close before they talk
internal_objections.authentic_response: Absolutely - this is a significant decision and you should have alignment. Here's what will help that conversation: What concerns or questions do you think [partner/board] will have? [Listen and address] What information would make it easier for you to get buy-in? I can prepare [ROI projection, case study, comparison document, etc.]. Also, would it help if I joined that conversation to answer questions directly? I've found that sometimes questions come up that are easier to address in real-time. What's your timeline for that discussion?
internal_objections.reframe: Support their internal selling process rather than fighting it

weekly_patterns.tuesday_wednesday: Peak engagementhighest email open rates, decision-makers available, best for pitches, proposals, and important calls
weekly_patterns.thursday: Execution dayclients focused on finishing week strong, good for tactical updates and quick wins, avoid heavy strategy discussions
weekly_patterns.friday: Low-priority dayclients mentally checked out, good for relationship-building content, avoid important asks or deadlines
weekly_patterns.weekend: Research modebusiness owners researching solutions, high website traffic but low conversion, focus on educational content

monthly_patterns.week_2: Execution modeteams focused on delivery, moderate engagement, good for check-ins and progress updates
monthly_patterns.week_3: Mid-month slumpenergy dips, focus on maintaining momentum, share quick wins and testimonials
monthly_patterns.week_4: Deadline pressureclients focused on monthly goals, lower engagement on new ideas, best for delivering results and reports
monthly_patterns.month_end: Results-drivenclients reviewing monthly performance, high receptivity to performance-based pitches, emphasize ROI and metrics

pricing_psychology.results_guarantee: Money-back guarantee if no qualified leads in 90 daysremoves risk, justifies premium pricing, filters serious buyers
